hook.text: 'I think, therefore I am.' The most famous sentence in philosophy.

buildup.text: Descartes' method: doubt everything. Senses deceive, math might be wrong, reality could be a dream.

discovery.text: Only one thing: the act of doubting itself proves a doubter exists.

twist.text: His rebuilding was less successful â€“ he needed God to guarantee truth, which many found unconvincing.

climax.text: Cartesian doubt lives on: in science, in philosophy, and in daily life.

punchline.text: He doubted everything and found the one undoubtable truth: doubt itself.

quiz.question: What is Descartes' method of systematic doubt?
options: Doubting all beliefs until finding something that cannot be doubted
